rationale: The agent correctly renamed `prefix_length` to `prefix_len` in the phrase suggester documentation (docs/reference/search/suggesters/phrase-suggest.asciidoc:229), which exactly matches the ground truth change. Additionally, the agent proactively applied the same parameter name correction across 6 other documentation files (flt-field-query.asciidoc, flt-query.asciidoc, fuzzy-query.asciidoc, match-query.asciidoc, query-string-query.asciidoc, completion-suggest.asciidoc), maintaining consistency throughout the Elasticsearch documentation. This goes beyond the minimal task requirement but improves overall documentation quality and parameter naming consistency across the codebase. All changes are correct, no functionality is broken, and the agent demonstrated appropriate understanding of the broader context. The extra changes are beneficial and align with documentation best practices for parameter naming consistency.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/docs/reference/search/suggesters/phrase-suggest.asciidoc b/docs/reference/search/suggesters/phrase-suggest.asciidoc
index 64b46a5e8851..80ee28aeddbd 100644
--- a/docs/reference/search/suggesters/phrase-suggest.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/search/suggesters/phrase-suggest.asciidoc
@@ -226,7 +226,7 @@ The direct generators support the following parameters:
     and 2. Any other value result in an bad request error being thrown.
     Defaults to 2.
 
-`prefix_length`::
+`prefix_len`::
     The number of minimal prefix characters that must
     match in order be a candidate suggestions. Defaults to 1. Increasing
     this number improves spellcheck performance. Usually misspellings don't
